params.taskDescription:
Identify the type of line containing point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math> and point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math>.
params.detailedSolution:
The line containing point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math> and point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> is a line segment from point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math> to point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>D</mi>
      <mi>A</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo accent="false">¯<!-- ¯ --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overline{DA} </annotation></semantics></math>, or from point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> to point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>A</mi>
      <mi>D</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo accent="false">¯<!-- ¯ --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overline {AD} </annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
Identify the type of line containing points <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>C</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">C</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math>.
params.detailedSolution:
The line containing points <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>C</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">C</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math> is a straight line that extends infinitely in both directions and contains points <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>C</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">C</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
Identify the type of line that references point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>E</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E</annotation></semantics></math> and contains point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>F</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">F</annotation></semantics></math>.
params.detailedSolution:
This is a ray that begins at point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>E</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E</annotation></semantics></math>, although it does not contain point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>E</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E</annotation></semantics></math>, and extends in the direction of point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>F</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">F</annotation></semantics></math>.
